page.title: 06FARMING 1
page.content: At Hillborough there is a{FISH FARM}It is a small business whose owner built it up in his own home and garden. Here there are cold stores with frozen catches from up to 20 local boats, about 5 tons per week landed. Salt water tanks keep live {LOBSTERS}Crabs, and Eels.Experiments at rearing Lobsters from eggs consistantly failed, but business booms. Live and frozen fish go to Billingsgte Grimsby Etc. The owner was a Restaurateur at Canterbury, but discovered the possibilities of fish wholesaling. Of {VILLAGE LIFE}:" nobody interferes and Government Busybodies dont come out this far". He knows of nothing he would rather do, and works long hours 7 days a week.On{MICRO COMPUTERS:}"all my business needs are served more efficiently by the books and files there".
